description: Daria Tomenko, after reviewing incendiary recordings implicating the Council, decides to conceal them. Instead, she proposes a citywide pause—urging all leaders to suspend formal governance and dedicate time to communal healing.
Council, pressured by Daria and community mediators, announces a two-week suspension of official authority for a "Festival of Closure." BCI and Council functions are taken offline.

The Festival of Closure begins: districts host open rituals, shared meals, and storytelling events. Citizens, including vanished and loyalist groups, publicly process the traumas and divisions created by BCI rule.
Spontaneous open forums give citizens of all backgrounds a chance to voice pain, grief, and hope, fostering surprising moments of empathy and fragile new alliances.
With the festival's end, residents elect a citywide assembly based on local representation. The BCI system and old Council quietly dissolve, ending the algorithmic era in Stenograd.
